quotes.quote: Trusting your individual uniqueness challenges you to lay yourself open.
I believe a unique core self is born into every human being; the result of millennia of environment and heredity combined in an unpredictable way that could never happen before or again.

You are obligated to understand that you are unique in the world. There has never been anyone like you because, of there were, there would be no need for you to exist. You are an utterly new thing in creation. Your life goal is to realize this uniqueness.

At bottom every man knows well enough that he is a unique being, only once on this earth; and by no extraordinary chance will such a marvelously picturesque piece of diversity in unity as he is, ever be put together a second time.
We are all, each and every one, unique in the Universe. And that uniqueness is what makes us valuable.

From the very beginning you are being told to compare yourself with others. This is the greatest disease; it is like a cancer that goes on destroying your very soul because each individual is unique, and comparison is not possible.
Embrace your uniqueness. Time is much too short to be living someone else's life.
A human being is a single being. Unique and unrepeatable.
Each of us is a unique strand in the intricate web of life and here to make a contribution.
Your unique way of doing things is what makes you so special so don't always feel the need to do things the way others want you to do them.
I personally like being unique. I like being my own person with my own style and my own opinions and my own toothbrush.
You are unique, and if that is not fulfilled, then something has been lost.
Insist on yourself; never imitate... Every great man is unique.
Everyone is unique. Compare not yourself with anyone else lest you spoil God's curriculum.
Every man and woman is born into the world to do something unique and something distinctive and if he or she does not do it, it will never be done.
Being unique is never easy, and often, by the time culture catches up with you, there are only a few people who notice.
Being unique is a lifelong process. It's difficult to be fresh and new all the time but it's the only way to be.
The goal is to become the unique, awesome, never to be repeated human being that we were called to be.
I suspect the secret of personal attraction is locked up in our unique imperfections, flaws and frailties.
Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
Being the best is great, you're the number one. Being unique is greater, you're the only one.
We're all unique, just never in the ways we imagine.
Every human being has his/her unique potential that is irreplaceable.
Every snowflake is unique, yet they are each perfect.
Uniqueness is what makes you the most beautiful.
Unique and different is the next generation of beautiful.
For being different, it's easy. But to be unique, it's a complicated thing.
Being unique is better than being perfect.
The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
I am a unique expression of the universal fabric of creation.
Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it.
Don't be afraid of being unique. It's like being afraid of your best self.
There is only one you in all time.
Who wants to be normal when you can be unique?
What it takes to be unique, is just to realize that you are one & only i.e. you are a unique creation. So, be & remain unique.
Don't let anyone tell you that you have to be a certain way. Be unique. Be what you feel.
I always find people who are unique very attractive.
A human being is so irreplaceable. So valuable and so unique.
Remember, you're unique. And so is everyone else.
Accept that you are unique. Stop comparing yourself to others as this can be damaging to your happiness and self-esteem.
Treasure the things about you that make you different and unique.
Each brain is exposed to different circumstances. It's very likely that your brain is unique in the history of the universe.
From the beginning, each human embryo has its own unique genetic identity.

What each must seek in his life was never on land or sea. It is something out of his own unique potentiality for experience. Something that never has been and never could have been experienced by anyone else.
In becoming fully human, we are called to be individuals. We are called to be unique and different. We are called to power.

Each of us is unique and special. No two sets of fingerprints are the same. although twins appear alike, they too, are different. Out of all the billions of people since the beginning of time, there will never be another you. so enjoy and appreciate your uniqueness.
Everyone is different. When you don't mind your difference, it stops being a problem and becomes your distinction.
I've always wanted to be somebody, but I see now I should have been more specific.
I didn't belong as a kid, and that always bothered me. If only I'd known that one day my differentness would be an asset, then my early life would have been much easier.
We have all been placed on this earth to discover our own path, and we will never be happy if we live someone else's idea of life.
You have two choices in life: You can dissolve into the mainstream or you can be distinct. To be distinct you must be different. To be different you must strive to be what no one else but you can be.

You have worth and unique value. You are more than enough. The world may seem to discredit you, or even oppose you, for one reason or another. Yet you have value that goes far beyond the superficial considerations of the world.
Pavarotti is not vain but is conscious of being unique.
The way you would draw a tree is different from the way anyone else would draw a tree-- and that's the way it's supposed to be.

So, at the root of all art and science there exists a gap-- a gap between what the world is like and what the human creator wishes and hopes for it to be like. Our unique way of bridging that gap in each of our lives  seems to me to be the essence of the reason for human creativity.

I think the greatest people in society carved niches that represented the unique expression of their combinations of talents, and if everyone had the luxury of expressing the unique combination of talents in this world, our society would be transformed overnight.
If each of billions or trillions of leaves and snowflakes can display its own unique individual identity, how much more so should not each human being?
While each mother-child relationship is unique, this loving bond in strengthened most by the love each party shows to the other.
Motherhood creates a unique kind of love that sees a child's faults, shortcomings, and strength but loves the child in spite of and because of them.
The British nation is unique in this respect. They are the only people who like to be told how bad things are, who like to be told the worst.
I believe every guitar player inherently has something unique about their playing. They just have to identify what makes them different and develop it.

We have certain standard of quality to be sure, but once music hits that level, we only react to a unique style, a fresh take on things. We don't like certain music because it's professional, we like it because it's raw, because it touched a nerve.
Dedicate yourself to writing and creating in ways that are unique to you, or spend your days living with fear and regret.
There's power in allowing yourself to be known and heard, in owning your unique story, in using your authentic voice
Every child is unique and precious, whatever and whomever, they look like.
You may exist here / But you cannot live / Without your soul / I am only your soul / Your life / Come to me / Merge into me / To become unique.

The power of your inner sense is your neutrality / The purity of your heart and mind is your fairness / The strength of your soul is your love and help / To all people, in all good matters / Though you are not a perfect / But you are a unique person.
You bring feelings that are hard for me to speak / for to find a word that has a meaning to what I am feeling / is to find something unique.
How I remember solstice days / Through many winters long completed! / Each unrepeatable, unique / And each one countless times repeated.
No matter what your differences are, you have to embrace them and be proud of the way you are.
What sets you apart can sometimes feel like a burden and it’s not. And a lot of the time, it’s what makes you great.
In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
Greatness starts from bearing the willingness to embrace your uniqueness at all times.
If you are always trying to be normal, you will never know how amazing you can be.
Being different isn’t a bad thing. It means you’re brave enough to be yourself.
People have a problem with me being different, but that propels me forward in life.
